discussion.author: CohenCyril
discussion.comment: I am a bit nervous about this ... `Let` declarations pollute the goal display, and in this case for theorems that are `Hint Resolve`, hence meant to be transparent to the user. Is there a new "invisible `Let`" feature that I am not aware of?

discussion.author: ppedrot
discussion.comment: @CohenCyril Alternatively we can define them inside the section if you prefer. Nonetheless, it seems that let-definitions are used pervasively in the mathcomp library.

discussion.author: affeldt-aist

review_discussion.author: gares
review_discussion.comment: In the rest of the PR you consistently use `Let` followed by `Local Hint` which seems fine. In this file, last two hunks, you use `Let` followed by `Hint`. Is it a problem?

review_discussion.author: gares
review_discussion.comment: For example here the hint is `Local` but `intr_inj_ZtoC` stays (even if its name is always qualified).

review_discussion.author: ppedrot
review_discussion.comment: Doesn't matter, in a section hints are implicitly local.
